definition:
1. Tending or able to repercuss; having the power of sending back; causing to reverberate. Ye repercussive rocks! repeat the sound. W. Pattison. 2. Repellent. [Obs.] "Blood is stanched by astringent and repecussive medicines." Bacon. 3. Driven back; rebounding; reverberated. "Rages loud the repercussive roar." Thomson.

A repellent. [Obs.] Bacon.
